metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11671 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.

criterions.comment: gcc-3.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
